item.title: Xbox Developer_Direct ’26 set for January 22
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox Series

Fable, Forza Horizon 6, and Beast of Reincarnation.

Microsoft will host “Xbox Developer_Direct ’26” on January 22 at 10:00 a.m. PT / 1:00 p.m. ET, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube and Twitch.

The broadcast will feature in-depth looks at the following titles:

  • Fable – Playground Games welcomes players back to the fairytale land of Albion, with the first in-depth look at Fable—one of 2026’s most anticipated titles. Developers from the Playground team will unveil the magic and mischief that awaits players in this fresh new beginning for the franchise, including a first look at some stunning new gameplay. Of course, the core themes of Fable will all be there—choice, consequence, drama, action, British humor and (of course) chickens, all reimagined for existing fans and new players alike.
  • Forza Horizon 6 – The Forza team from Playground Games will share a deep-dive on the much-anticipated Forza Horizon 6 as the open world racer takes players to the beautiful and contrasting landscapes of Japan. The segment will deep-dive into a very first look at gameplay, including reveals of new features—and how Japan comes to life in this stunning new installment.
  • Beast of Reincarnation – Join us as we delve into Game Freak‘s intense one-person, one-dog action RPG. For the first time, Game Freak will reveal details of our protagonist Emma’s innovative plant manipulation actions and gameplay with her canine companion, Koo. In Beast of Reincarnation, a profound and dangerous world unfolds in post-apocalyptic Japan. Discover the development secrets behind its creation in Developer_Direct.


https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/xbox-developer_direct-26-set-for-january-22

item.title: Kinetic Games establishes Kinetic Publishing
item.content:encoded:
'Championing innovation within the independent game development space.'

Phasmaphobia developer Kinetic Games has announced the establishment of Kinetic Publishing, a new publishing label that “aims to champion innovation within the independent game development space.”

Kinetic Publishing will focus on a small slate of games “who have a clear vision for their title” and are “12 to 18 months from release,” providing “meaningful attention” and “tailored support” to teams on games across a “wide range” of genres.

The label will offer the financial, legal, marketing support, and wider development guidance that Kinetic Games CEO and formerly-solo developer Daniel Knight says he would have wanted when Phasmaphobia first launched in Early Access in 2020.

“It’s such an exciting time for indie game development, I can say that in the past five years I’ve learned so much,” said Kinetic Games CEO and Phasmaphobia game director Daniel Knight in a press release. “The fact we’ve grown so much as a company means we’re now in the place where we want to support studios who come under our wing, and provide the support I’d have appreciated at the start of my journey.”

Kinetic Publishing director of marketing and partnerships Asim Tanvir added, “We want to join the ranks of supportive indie publishers who champion and encourage creativity. We hope the guidance and support that we provide to indie teams will help in ensuring they succeed in what they do best, as well as encouraging innovation within the development space.”

Visit the publisher’s official website here.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/kinetic-games-establishes-kinetic-publishing
